CVE-2025-0399
(4.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T00:30:55

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in StarSea99 starsea-mall 1.0. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function UploadController of the file src/main/java/com/siro/mall/controller/common/uploadController.java. The manipulation of the argument file leads to unrestricted upload. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2021-30184
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.35%

updated 2025-01-12T21:15:18.060000

2 posts

GNU Chess 6.2.7 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted PGN (Portable Game Notation) data. This is related to a buffer overflow in the use of a .tmp.epd temporary file in the cmd_pgnload and cmd_pgnreplay functions in frontend/cmd.cc.

chris_bloke@mastodon.acm.org at 2025-01-12T19:37:59.000Z ##

From 2021, but only just saw it.

> CVE-2021-30184
> GNU Chess 6.2.7 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted PGN (Portable Game Notation) data.

Reminds me of Wargames - "strange game, the only way to win is not to play - how about a nice game of chess?" ♟️

Maybe Joshua was playing the long game against us? 😉

It is recommended to upgrade the affected component.

CVE-2025-23109
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-11T04:15:06.367000

2 posts

Long hostnames in URLs could be leveraged to obscure the actual host of the website or spoof the website address This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 134.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.686Z ##

Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2025-06 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox for iOS 134
Mozilla has the audacity to drop a security advisory early Saturday morning and call it Friday night's release. They get a pass this time because they're headquartered in San Francisco CA (GMT-8 or Pacific time zone) and their state is on fire. Two CVEs patched:

  • CVE-2025-23108 (moderate) Firefox Mobile iOS Full Address Bar Spoof Using Open in New Tab and Javascript URI
  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

No mention of exploitation

#mozilla #firefox #ios #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.000Z ##

  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

updated 2025-01-11T00:32:06

CVE-2025-22152
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-10T16:15:29.910000

2 posts

Atheos is a self-hosted browser-based cloud IDE. Prior to v600, the $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files. This vulnerability is fixed in v600.

cR0w at 2025-01-10T15:52:28.909Z ##

I don't know WTF Atheos is ( it says it's "A self-hosted browser-based cloud IDE, updated from Codiad IDE" ) but since someone was jonesing for a ../ yesterday, here's a sev:CRIT for you: https://github.com/Atheos/Atheos/security/advisories/GHSA-rgjm-6p59-537v

The $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22152

And I don't have time to edit a new gif right now so here's Taylor Swift demonstrating how to traverse those directories up the path to find the web shell.

##

The $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files.

FastCGI fcgi2 (aka fcgi) 2.x through 2.4.4 has an integer overflow (and resultant heap-based buffer overflow) via crafted nameLen or valueLen values in data to the IPC socket. This occurs in ReadParams in fcgiapp.c.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23016

CVE-2025-21380
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-09T23:15:08.340000

4 posts

Improper access control in Azure SaaS Resources allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network.

AAKL at 2025-01-10T15:54:12.979Z ##

Posted yesterday, Microsoft security updates, two critical January entries https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide

- CVE-2025-21380 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21380
- CVE-2025-21385 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21385 #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T23:31:27.965Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories 09 January 2025:

  • CVE-2025-21380 (8.8 high) Azure Marketplace SaaS Resources Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • Improper access control in Azure SaaS Resources allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)
  • CVE-2025-21385 (8.8 high) Microsoft Purview Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • A Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Microsoft Purview allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF))

Not publicly disclosed, not exploited, Exploitability assessment N/A.

#microsoft #msrc #azure #purview #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

- CVE-2025-21385 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21385 #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2025-0282
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.95%

updated 2025-01-09T22:15:29.870000

110 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

5 repos

https://github.com/absholi7ly/CVE-2025-0282-Ivanti-exploit

https://github.com/BishopFox/CVE-2025-0282-check

https://github.com/AnonStorks/CVE-2025-0282-Full-version

https://github.com/NyxanGoat/CVE-2025-0282-PoC

https://github.com/securexploit1/CVE-2025-0282

screaminggoat at 2025-01-12T14:12:33.553Z ##

watchTowr: Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
See parent toots for details. Following up on the root cause analysis of CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, watchTowr provides a walkthrough of how they approached exploiting the vulnerability. They intend to publicly release a "Detection Artifact Generator" (read: proof of concept) until 16 January 2025 (another 4 days) cc: @wdormann

#ivanti #CVE_2025_0282 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-10T02:21:08.770Z ##

watchTowr: Do Secure-By-Design Pledges Come With Stickers? - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
Absolutely scathing review and rightful criticism of Ivanti as watchTowr successfully reproduces CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. I'm here for the McMemes and I'm lovin' it.® watchTowr does not provide the proof of concept but it's not necessary as it's already being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann

#ivanti #zeroday #cve_2025_0282 #eitw #vulnerability #cve #activeexploitation #cisa #cisakev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-09T14:52:18.566Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283 #UNC5337 #UNC5221 #PHASEJAM #SPAWNMOLE
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-09T14:42:30.689Z ##

Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283
https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/active-exploitation-ivanti-vulnerability

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #IoC #postexploitation
#attribution
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T05:45:59.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0282 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0282/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T23:50:01.604Z ##

CISA: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
This is absolutely fancy: CISA provides guidance on mitigating CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. This includes steps to take if your threat hunting determines that there was a compromise. Shoutout to CISA to enriching the standard KEV addition blog post.

#cisa #CVE_2025_0282 #ivanti #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T17:54:02.897Z ##

NCSC-UK: Active exploitation of vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways products
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC-UK) has one of the earliest government security advisories about CVE-2025-0282 exploitation. See parent toots above for details.

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T17:49:20.082Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet 🥵🔥🔥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-12T14:12:33.000Z ##

watchTowr: Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
See parent toots for details. Following up on the root cause analysis of CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, watchTowr provides a walkthrough of how they approached exploiting the vulnerability. They intend to publicly release a "Detection Artifact Generator" (read: proof of concept) until 16 January 2025 (another 4 days) cc: @wdormann

#ivanti #CVE_2025_0282 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T02:21:08.000Z ##

watchTowr: Do Secure-By-Design Pledges Come With Stickers? - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
Absolutely scathing review and rightful criticism of Ivanti as watchTowr successfully reproduces CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. I'm here for the McMemes and I'm lovin' it.® watchTowr does not provide the proof of concept but it's not necessary as it's already being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann

#ivanti #zeroday #cve_2025_0282 #eitw #vulnerability #cve #activeexploitation #cisa #cisakev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.000Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet 🥵🔥🔥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
mersan at 2025-01-10T12:15:25.884Z ##

📶 Ivanti 0Day CVSS 9.0 🆘

✍️ Las VPN corporativas se convierten en puertas traseras para los piratas informáticos chinos.

➡️ Se ha descubierto una vulnerabilidad crítica con una clasificación CVSS de 9.0 en los productos de Ivanti (https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day) que permite la ejecución remota de código sin autorización.

🔥 El grupo chino UNC5337 ya está explotando activamente la brecha para penetrar en las redes corporativas.

👨‍💻 Los piratas informáticos utilizan el ecosistema malicioso SPAWN para robar sesiones y contraseñas de VPN. Al mismo tiempo, los atacantes utilizan herramientas especiales para ocultar rastros de su presencia en el sistema.

⚡️ CISA requiere que las agencias federales instalen actualizaciones de seguridad antes del 15 de enero. Se recomienda a todas las organizaciones que escaneen urgentemente sus sistemas para detectar señales de compromiso.

CVE-2025-0283 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0283)
CVE-2025-0282 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0282)
Cisa Vulnerability Kev Catalog (https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog)

S.I Stega Intelligence

🪪 Nuestros Contactos (https://stegaops.com/contact/)

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:50:22.928Z ##

@jerry Ivanti zero-day mega-toot:

  • Ivanti blog post: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways
  • Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283)
  • U.S. CISA mitigation guidance: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
  • Mandiant observed post-exploitation activity and forensics (includes IOC, Yara): Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation

Government security advisories:

  • U.S.: Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways; CISA Adds One Vulnerability to the KEV Catalog
  • Canada: Ivanti security advisory (AV25-008)
  • UK: Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure

Regular infosec news reporting:

  • Security Week: Ivanti Warns of New Zero-Day Attacks Hitting Connect Secure Product
  • The Record: Ivanti warns hackers are exploiting new vulnerability
  • Bleeping Computer: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks
##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.105Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

#china #cyberespionage #ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2024_0282 #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Yara #infosec #cybersecurity #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

CVE-2024-12854 – “WordPress Garden Gnome Package Plugin Remote Code Execution File Upload Vulnerability”

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T01:50:22.000Z ##

@jerry Ivanti zero-day mega-toot:

  • Ivanti blog post: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways
  • Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283)
  • U.S. CISA mitigation guidance: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
  • Mandiant observed post-exploitation activity and forensics (includes IOC, Yara): Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation

Government security advisories:

  • U.S.: Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways; CISA Adds One Vulnerability to the KEV Catalog
  • Canada: Ivanti security advisory (AV25-008)
  • UK: Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure

Regular infosec news reporting:

  • Security Week: Ivanti Warns of New Zero-Day Attacks Hitting Connect Secure Product
  • The Record: Ivanti warns hackers are exploiting new vulnerability
  • Bleeping Computer: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks
##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.000Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

#china #cyberespionage #ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2024_0282 #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Yara #infosec #cybersecurity #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways

The vulnerabilities, identified as CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283, are currently being actively exploited by malicious actors.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-08T18:49:02.000Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways customers, it's time to upgrade again as there's another two zero days already being exploited in the wild - CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283

Unauth code execution.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283?language=en_US

ASLR prevents buffer overflow attacks, which CVE-2025-0282 is. However only about 5% of binaries in Ivanti's 'secure' Linux appliance have ASLR enabled - a two decade old security control. #yolosec https://infosec.exchange/@wdormann/113794200056523116

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T18:11:17.000Z ##

@wdormann I created a vendor verbiage page to decipher the sometimes obfuscated wording of exploitation: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/vendor-verbiage In this case, it was straightforward:

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

CISA appears to be adding it to the KEV Catalog: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog (Access Denied usually means the URL is correct but* the page isn't published yet) EDIT: Page is live.

and NCSC had the first government advisory about it: https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/active-exploitation-ivanti-vulnerabilities

I blasted it on Mastodon an hour ago: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/113793817841894943

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:04:23.000Z ##

IVANTI ZERO-DAY: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways

  • CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) stack-based buffer overflow > unauth RCE
  • CVE-2025-0283 (7.0 high) authenticated LPE

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

Check out the Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283) for frequently asked questions. cc: @goatyell

#zeroday #ivanti #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

updated 2025-01-09T22:15:29.773000

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133 and Thunderbird 133. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134 and Thunderbird < 134.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T21:51:44.000Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

##

CVE-2025-21598
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-09T19:15:20.123000

4 posts

An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd. This issue affects: Junos OS:  * from 21.2R3-S8 before 21.2R3-S9,  * from 21.4R3-S7 before 21.4R3-S9,  * from

screaminggoat at 2025-01-10T17:03:30.247Z ##

Juniper security advisory 08 January 2025: 2025-01 Security Bulletin: Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved: When BGP traceoptions are configured, receipt of malformed BGP packets causes RPD to crash (CVE-2025-21598)
CVE-2025-21598 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5, v4.0: 8.2 high) An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd.
Multiple requirements are listed in the advisory for exposure to this vulnerability. Disabling packet tracing options will work around this issue.

Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

#juniper #junos #CVE_2025_21598 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

Multiple requirements are listed in the advisory for exposure to this vulnerability. Disabling packet tracing options will work around this issue.

Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T16:16:21.743000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the Gen7 SonicOS Cloud platform NSv, allows a remote authenticated local low-privileged attacker to elevate privileges to `root` and potentially lead to code execution.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

##

CVE-2024-12802
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:58

1 posts

SSL-VPN MFA Bypass in SonicWALL SSL-VPN can arise in specific cases due to the separate handling of UPN (User Principal Name) and SAM (Security Account Manager) account names when integrated with Microsoft Active Directory, allowing MFA to be configured independently for each login method and potentially enabling attackers to bypass MFA by exploiting the alternative account name.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T21:51:44.000Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-53704
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:57

5 posts

An Improper Authentication vulnerability in the SSLVPN authentication mechanism allows a remote attacker to bypass authentication.

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2025-01-09T10:40:02.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:33:13.000Z ##

https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0003 advisory is posted. This covers CVE-2024-40762, CVE-2024-53704, CVE-2024-53705 and CVE-2024-53706.

#vulnerability #sonicwall #cve

##
adulau@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T12:44:48.000Z ##

Sonicwall (SonicOS) vulnerabilities.

SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability. CVE-2024-53704 sounds not very good but the others seem quite critical too.

Bundle created in @vulnerability_lookup from a imgur reference.

🔗 https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/602ffeaf-2425-48cc-967c-0efad9629dd0

##

CVE-2024-12803
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:57

1 posts

A post-authentication stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to crash a firewall and potentially leads to code execution.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T21:51:44.000Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:57

1 posts

An Integer-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS via IPSec allows a remote attacker in specific conditions to cause Denial of Service (DoS) and potentially execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted IKEv2 payload.

  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability

CVE-2024-40762
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:15.370000

2 posts

Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) in the SonicOS SSLVPN authentication token generator that, in certain cases, can be predicted by an attacker potentially resulting in authentication bypass.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:33:13.000Z ##

When a user is created via the SAML provider, the external groups setting overrides the external provider configuration. As a result, the user may not be marked as external thereby giving those users access to internal projec

updated 2025-01-09T06:30:35

1 posts

  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion
  • CVE-2024-12431 (4.3 medium) Unauthorized user can manipulate status of issues in public projects
  • CVE-2024-13041 (4.3 medium) Instance SAML does not respect external_provider configuration

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #IoC #postexploitation
#attribution
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T05:45:59.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0283 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0283/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0283

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.000Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

##
mersan at 2025-01-10T12:15:25.884Z ##

📶 Ivanti 0Day CVSS 9.0 🆘

✍️ Las VPN corporativas se convierten en puertas traseras para los piratas informáticos chinos.

➡️ Se ha descubierto una vulnerabilidad crítica con una clasificación CVSS de 9.0 en los productos de Ivanti (https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day) que permite la ejecución remota de código sin autorización.

🔥 El grupo chino UNC5337 ya está explotando activamente la brecha para penetrar en las redes corporativas.

👨‍💻 Los piratas informáticos utilizan el ecosistema malicioso SPAWN para robar sesiones y contraseñas de VPN. Al mismo tiempo, los atacantes utilizan herramientas especiales para ocultar rastros de su presencia en el sistema.

⚡️ CISA requiere que las agencias federales instalen actualizaciones de seguridad antes del 15 de enero. Se recomienda a todas las organizaciones que escaneen urgentemente sus sistemas para detectar señales de compromiso.

CVE-2025-0283 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0283)
CVE-2025-0282 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0282)
Cisa Vulnerability Kev Catalog (https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog)

S.I Stega Intelligence

🪪 Nuestros Contactos (https://stegaops.com/contact/)

VirusBulletin at 2025-01-09T10:34:32.597Z ##

Researchers from Mandiant and Ivanti look into an active campaign exploiting two vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-0282 & CVE-2025-0283, impacting Ivanti Connect Secure VPN appliances. They observed the known SPAWN ecosystem of malware but also new families DRYHOOK & PHASEJAM. https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:50:22.928Z ##

@jerry Ivanti zero-day mega-toot:

  • Ivanti blog post: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways
  • Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283)
  • U.S. CISA mitigation guidance: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
  • Mandiant observed post-exploitation activity and forensics (includes IOC, Yara): Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation

Government security advisories:

  • U.S.: Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways; CISA Adds One Vulnerability to the KEV Catalog
  • Canada: Ivanti security advisory (AV25-008)
  • UK: Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure

Regular infosec news reporting:

  • Security Week: Ivanti Warns of New Zero-Day Attacks Hitting Connect Secure Product
  • The Record: Ivanti warns hackers are exploiting new vulnerability
  • Bleeping Computer: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks

Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways

🚨🚨🚨Ivanti, a leading provider of enterprise security solutions, has announced the discovery of two critical zero-day vulnerabilities in its Connect Secure (ICS) product. https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-ivanti-connect-secure-policy-secure-and-neurons-for-zta-gateways

The vulnerabilities, identified as CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283, are currently being actively exploited by malicious actors.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-08T18:49:02.000Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways customers, it's time to upgrade again as there's another two zero days already being exploited in the wild - CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283

Unauth code execution.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283?language=en_US

ASLR prevents buffer overflow attacks, which CVE-2025-0282 is. However only about 5% of binaries in Ivanti's 'secure' Linux appliance have ASLR enabled - a two decade old security control. #yolosec https://infosec.exchange/@wdormann/113794200056523116

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:04:23.000Z ##

IVANTI ZERO-DAY: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways

  • CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) stack-based buffer overflow > unauth RCE
  • CVE-2025-0283 (7.0 high) authenticated LPE

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

Check out the Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283) for frequently asked questions. cc: @goatyell

#zeroday #ivanti #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2024-53995(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T22:04:00

6 posts

SickChill is an automatic video library manager for TV shows. A user-controlled `login` endpoint's `next_` parameter takes arbitrary content. Prior to commit c7128a8946c3701df95c285810eb75b2de18bf82, an authenticated attacker may use this to redirect the user to arbitrary destinations, leading to open redirect. Commit c7128a8946c3701df95c285810eb75b2de18bf82 changes the login page to redirect to `

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-08T21:44:30.000Z ##

CVE-2024-53995 – SickChill Open Redirect Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2024-53995 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 9:15 p.m. | 29 minutes ago Description : SickChill is an automatic video library manager for TV shows. A user-controlled `login` endpoint's `next_` parameter takes arbitrary content. Prior to commit c7128a8946c3701df95c285810eb75b2de18bf82, an authenticated attacker may use this to redirect the user to arbitrary destinations, leading to open redirect. Commit c7128a8946c3701df95c285810eb75b2de18bf82 changes the login page to redirect to […]

##

CVE-2025-22145(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:51:38

6 posts

### Impact Application passing unsanitized user input to `Carbon::setLocale` are at risk of arbitrary file include, if the application allows users to upload files with `.php` extension in an folder that allows `include` or `require` to read it, then they are at risk of arbitrary code ran on their servers. ### Patches - [3.8.4](https://github.com/briannesbitt/Carbon/releases/tag/3.8.4) - [2.72.6]

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-08T21:44:32.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22145 – Carbon PHP DateTime Remote File Include Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22145 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 9:15 p.m. | 29 minutes ago Description : Carbon is an international PHP extension for DateTime. Application passing unsanitized user input to Carbon::setLocale are at risk of arbitrary file include, if the application allows users to upload files with .php extension in an folder that allows include or require to read it, then they are at risk of arbitrary code ran on their servers. This vulnerability is fixed in 3.8.4 and […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2025-22145-carbon-php-datetime-remote-file-include-vulnerability/2827/

##

CVE-2024-55517
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:33:30

6 posts

An issue was discovered in the Interllect Core Search in Polaris FT Intellect Core Banking 9.5. Input passed through the groupType parameter in /SCGController is mishandled before being used in SQL queries, allowing SQL injection in an authenticated session.

CVE-2024-51442
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:33:30

5 posts

Command Injection in Minidlna version v1.3.3 and before allows an attacker to execute arbitrary OS commands via a specially crafted minidlna.conf configuration file.

(3.4 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:32:34

3 posts

A vulnerability in the firewall component of HPE Aruba Networking CX 10000 Series Switches exists. It could allow an unauthenticated adjacent attacker to conduct a packet forwarding attack against the ICMP and UDP protocol. For this attack to be successful an attacker requires a switch configuration that allows packets routing (at layer 3). Configurations that do not allow network traffic routin

CVE ID : CVE-2024-54010 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 9:15 p.m. | 29 minutes ago Description : A vulnerability in the firewall component of HPE Aruba Networking CX 10000 Series Switches exists. GitLab security advisory 08 January 2025: GitLab Patch Release: 17.7.1, 17.6.3, 17.5.5

  • CVE-2025-0194 (6.5 medium) Possible access token exposure in GitLab logs
  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion
  • CVE-2024-12431 (4.3 medium) Unauthorized user can manipulate status of issues in public projects
  • CVE-2024-13041 (4.3 medium) Instance SAML does not respect external_provider configuration

No mention of exploitation

CVE-2024-13190
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:32:33

2 posts

A vulnerability classified as critical was found in ZeroWdd myblog 1.0. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file src/main/resources/mapper/BlogMapper.xml. The manipulation of the argument findBlogList/getTotalBlogs leads to xml injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-08T21:44:29.000Z ##

CVE-2024-13190 – ZeroWdd Myblog Xml Injection

CVE ID : CVE-2024-13190 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 9:15 p.m. | 29 minutes ago Description : A vulnerability classified as critical was found in ZeroWdd myblog 1.0. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file src/main/resources/mapper/BlogMapper.xml. The manipulation of the argument findBlogList/getTotalBlogs leads to xml injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Severity: 6.3 | MEDIUM Visit the link for more […]

https://whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-13190-zerowdd-myblog-xml-injection/2819/

##
daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-08T21:44:18.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-13189
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:32:33

2 posts

A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in ZeroWdd myblog 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file src/main/java/com/wdd/myblog/config/MyBlogMvcConfig.java. The manipulation leads to permission issues. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

daud@whalers.ir at 2025-01-08T21:44:24.000Z ##

CVE-2024-13189 – ZeroWdd MyBlog Remote File Permission Bypass Vulnerability

CVE ID : CVE-2024-13189 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 8:15 p.m. | 1 hour, 28 minutes ago Description : A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in ZeroWdd myblog 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file src/main/java/com/wdd/myblog/config/MyBlogMvcConfig.java. The manipulation leads to permission issues. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Severity: 7.3 | HIGH Visit the link for more details, such […]

CVE-2025-0194
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T21:32:26

9 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 17.4 prior to 17.5.1, starting from 17.6 prior to 17.6.1, and starting from 17.7 prior to 17.7.1. Under certain conditions, access tokens may have been logged when API requests were made in a specific manner.

CVE-2025-0194 – GitLab Information Disclosure

CVE ID : CVE-2025-0194 Published : Jan. 8, 2025, 8:15 p.m. | 1 hour, 28 minutes ago Description : An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 17.4 prior to 17.5.1, starting from 17.6 prior to 17.6.1, and starting from 17.7 prior to 17.7.1. Under certain conditions, access tokens may have been logged when API requests were made in a specific manner. screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T16:11:35.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory 08 January 2025: GitLab Patch Release: 17.7.1, 17.6.3, 17.5.5

  • CVE-2025-0194 (6.5 medium) Possible access token exposure in GitLab logs
  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion
  • CVE-2024-12431 (4.3 medium) Unauthorized user can manipulate status of issues in public projects
  • CVE-2024-13041 (4.3 medium) Instance SAML does not respect external_provider configuration

No mention of exploitation

CVE-2024-55550
(2.7 LOW)

EPSS: 42.72%

updated 2025-01-08T20:46:01.203000

3 posts

Mitel MiCollab through 9.8 SP2 could allow an authenticated attacker with administrative privilege to conduct a local file read, due to insufficient input sanitization. A successful exploit could allow the authenticated admin attacker to access resources that are constrained to the admin access level, and the disclosure is limited to non-sensitive system information. This vulnerability does not al

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-07T16:01:06.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-55550
Vendor: Mitel
Product: MiCollab
Date Added: 2025-01-07
Vulnerability: Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.mitel.com/support/security-advisories/mitel-product-security-advisory-misa-2024-0029 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-55550
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-55550

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T15:54:43.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
New year, new exploitation: Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-41713 (9.1 critical) Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55550 (4.4 medium) Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-2883 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T15:15:47.000Z ##

Out of winter hibernation, CISA has updated the KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-41713: Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-41713

- CVE-2024-55550: Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-55550

- CVE-2020-2883: Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2020-2883

Posted yesterday: CISA Update on Treasury Breach https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/news/cisa-update-treasury-breach @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec #Oracle

##

CVE-2024-41713
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.15%

updated 2025-01-08T20:31:25.237000

3 posts

A vulnerability in the NuPoint Unified Messaging (NPM) component of Mitel MiCollab through 9.8 SP1 FP2 (9.8.1.201) could allow an unauthenticated attacker to conduct a path traversal attack, due to insufficient input validation. A successful exploit could allow unauthorized access, enabling the attacker to view, corrupt, or delete users' data and system configurations.

Nuclei template

4 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/Mitel-MiCollab-Auth-Bypass_CVE-2024-41713

https://github.com/Sanandd/cve-2024-CVE-2024-41713

https://github.com/zxj-hub/CVE-2024-41713POC

https://github.com/amanverma-wsu/CVE-2024-41713-Scan

(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-08T20:15:29.353000

16 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.264 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2025-01-07T19:02:43.146Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 131.0.6778.264/.265 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.264 for Linux includes 4 security fixes, including 1 externally reported: CVE-2025-0291 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. No mention of exploitation

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T00:29:25.000Z ##

CVE-2018-4301 was published today: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-4301

But the advisory was published 28 May 2018: https://smartcardservices.github.io/security/

This issue is fixed in SCSSU-201801. A potential stack based buffer overflow existed in GemaltoKeyHandle.cpp.

CVE-2024-12853
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-08T12:30:47

1 posts

The Modula Image Gallery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to missing file type validation in the zip upload functionality in all versions up to, and including, 2.11.10. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible.

CVE-2020-2883
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.51%

updated 2025-01-08T02:00:01.937000

4 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via IIOP, T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Oracle

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T15:54:43.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
New year, new exploitation: Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-41713 (9.1 critical) Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55550 (4.4 medium) Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-2883 (9.8 critical) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T15:15:47.000Z ##

Out of winter hibernation, CISA has updated the KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-41713: Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-41713

- CVE-2024-55550: Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-55550

- CVE-2020-2883: Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2020-2883

Posted yesterday: CISA Update on Treasury Breach https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/news/cisa-update-treasury-breach @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec #Oracle

##

CVE-2024-50603
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.96%

updated 2025-01-08T01:15:07.127000

6 posts

An issue was discovered in Aviatrix Controller before 7.1.4191 and 7.2.x before 7.2.4996. Due to the improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command, an unauthenticated attacker is able to execute arbitrary code. Shell metacharacters can be sent to /v1/api in cloud_type for list_flightpath_destination_instances, or src_cloud_type for flightpath_connection_test.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/newlinesec/CVE-2024-50603

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-50603

screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T20:00:58.215Z ##

@cR0w probably. I mean, the likelihood of exploitation goes up the easier and more convenient a prevalent vulnerability is. This being a 10.0 means no privileges required, attack complexity is low, no user interaction required, and remotely exploitable. This also had a publicly available proof of concept. The way Wiz described it, cybercriminals are cryptomining with their access.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T19:18:59.658Z ##

Wiz: Wiz Research Identifies Exploitation in the Wild of Aviatrix Controller RCE (CVE-2024-50603)
CVE-2024-50603 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳) Aviatrix Controller RCE. Wiz Research identified evidence of successful exploitation of this vulnerability across several cloud environments. Indicators of compromise provided.

When deployed in AWS cloud environments, Aviatrix Controller allows privilege escalation by default

cc: @todb @cR0w

#aviatrix #cve_2024_50603 #eitw #vulnerability #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T14:48:40.000Z ##

Does anyone use the Aviatrix Network Controller? I don't know anything about it but a CVSS 10 command injection in a network controller seems a bit yikes. Advisory and CVE published yesterday so I may be slow to this one.

A vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary command against Aviatrix Controllers. As of January 7, 2025, Aviatrix is not aware of any known exploit activity.

https://docs.aviatrix.com/documentation/latest/release-notices/psirt-advisories/psirt-advisories.html?expand=true#remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-aviatrix-controllers

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50603

##

CVE-2025-0218
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T21:31:01

2 posts

When batch jobs are executed by pgAgent, a script is created in a temporary directory and then executed. In versions of pgAgent prior to 4.2.3, an insufficiently seeded random number generator is used when generating the directory name, leading to the possibility for a local attacker to pre-create the directory and thus prevent pgAgent from executing jobs, disrupting scheduled tasks.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-08T05:52:27.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22621
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T17:15:35.710000

2 posts

In versions 1.0.67 and lower of the Splunk App for SOAR, the Splunk documentation for that app recommended adding the `admin_all_objects` capability to the `splunk_app_soar` role. This addition could lead to improper access control for a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ Splunk roles.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T17:36:16.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from Splunk:

  • SVD-2025-0101 Privilege escalation for users who hold the "splunk_app_soar" role in the Splunk App for SOAR
    • CVE-2025-22621 (6.4 medium) Splunk App for SOAR privilege escalation vulnerability
  • SVD-2025-0102 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Add-on for JBoss - January 2025

No mention of exploitation.

#Splunk #soar #jboss #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T17:27:48.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22621 is an interesting one in Splunk app for SOAR.

In versions 1.0.67 and lower of the Splunk App for SOAR, the Splunk documentation for that app recommended adding the admin_all_objects capability to the splunk_app_soar role. This addition could lead to improper access control for a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ Splunk roles.

I'm not sure I remember a CVE for poor recommendations in the documentation.

https://advisory.splunk.com/advisories/SVD-2025-0101

1 posts

In wlan STA driver, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-03T12:30:31

5 posts

File upload logic is flawed vulnerability in Apache Struts. An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. This issue affects Apache Struts: from 2.0.0 before 6.4.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 6.4.0 at least and migrate to the new

(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-03T09:15:06.370000

8 posts

Moxa’s cellular routers, secure routers, and network security appliances are affected by a high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2024-9138. This vulnerability involves hard-coded credentials, enabling an authenticated user to escalate privileges and gain root-level access to the system, posing a significant security risk.

CVE-2024-12856
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-27T18:15:23.677000

2 posts

The Four-Faith router models F3x24 and F3x36 are affected by an operating system (OS) command injection vulnerability. At least firmware version 2.0 allows authenticated and remote attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands over HTTP when modifying the system time via apply.cgi. Additionally, this firmware version has default credentials which, if not changed, would effectively change this vulnera

1 repos

https://github.com/nu113d/CVE-2024-12856

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T20:17:16.484Z ##

QiAnXin: Gayfemboy: A Botnet Deliver Through a Four-Faith Industrial Router 0-day Exploit.
This is certainly a read: QiAnXin's XLAB reports on the Gayfemboy botnet, which is a Mirai variant whose operators are becoming more sophisticated since February 2024 with the inclusion of N-day and now zero-day vulnerabilities such as CVE-2024-12856 (7.2 high) Four-Faith Industrial Router post-auth command injection.

Interestingly, when it detected our registration of its domains, it retaliated immediately with a DDoS attack—an act of notable hostility.

QiAnXin describes the botnet's geographic spread, the exploited vulnerabilities (cc: @todb), analysis of the Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS), and a Gayfemboy sample. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#Gayfemboy #ddos #mirai #botnet #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T20:17:16.000Z ##

QiAnXin: Gayfemboy: A Botnet Deliver Through a Four-Faith Industrial Router 0-day Exploit.
This is certainly a read: QiAnXin's XLAB reports on the Gayfemboy botnet, which is a Mirai variant whose operators are becoming more sophisticated since February 2024 with the inclusion of N-day and now zero-day vulnerabilities such as CVE-2024-12856 (7.2 high) Four-Faith Industrial Router post-auth command injection.

Interestingly, when it detected our registration of its domains, it retaliated immediately with a DDoS attack—an act of notable hostility.

QiAnXin describes the botnet's geographic spread, the exploited vulnerabilities (cc: @todb), analysis of the Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS), and a Gayfemboy sample. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#Gayfemboy #ddos #mirai #botnet #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 42.67%

updated 2024-12-20T18:32:37

2 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T02:09:44.957Z ##

@zl2tod @jerry Yeah January 2024 was a fun month:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024
    • Citrix zero-days CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
    • Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-0519: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
    • Atlassian perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 CVE-2024-22527 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVE-2024-11053
(3.4 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-15T17:15:05.273000

1 posts

When asked to both use a `.netrc` file for credentials and to follow HTTP redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the followed-to host under certain circumstances. This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has an entry that matches the redirect target hostname but the entry either omits just the password or omits both login and password.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2025-01-07T10:54:06.000Z ##

"After intensive bisecting, it turns out this bug was incorrectly believed to have been introduced in a certain commit, while in fact it was introduced much later. As of January 7th, we have updated the metadata for this CVE and now it is no longer the oldest bug fixed in #curl..."

(me writing about CVE-2024-11053)

CVE-2024-9681
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-13T14:15:22.953000

4 posts

When curl is asked to use HSTS, the expiry time for a subdomain might overwrite a parent domain's cache entry, making it end sooner or later than otherwise intended. This affects curl using applications that enable HSTS and use URLs with the insecure `HTTP://` scheme and perform transfers with hosts like `x.example.com` as well as `example.com` where the first host is a subdomain of the second ho

eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-09T19:35:31.000Z ##

@bagder this feels like a CVSS issue. The folks who developed the _severity_ metric know it doesn't do a great job correlating importance, but it's the best we have and FedRAMP and other standards make following it a requirement 🥲

(@zmanion has a talk about the pitfalls of defining CVSS in his talk Desperately Seeking Severity)

CISA scored CVE-2024-9681 slightly lower than NVD (Availability None instead of Low).

Is CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N incorrect?

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T15:04:20.000Z ##

Congratulations all crowd strike users on macOS who now get warnings about the #libcurl version shipped by Apple. May you all enjoy your choices of software vendors.

It alerts about CVE-2024-9681. We said it is severity low. NVD says 6.5 medium.

Never a dull moment.

##
eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-09T19:35:31.000Z ##

@bagder this feels like a CVSS issue. The folks who developed the _severity_ metric know it doesn't do a great job correlating importance, but it's the best we have and FedRAMP and other standards make following it a requirement 🥲

(@zmanion has a talk about the pitfalls of defining CVSS in his talk Desperately Seeking Severity)

CISA scored CVE-2024-9681 slightly lower than NVD (Availability None instead of Low).

Is CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N incorrect?

##

Never a dull moment.

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install and activate arbitrary plugins which can be leveraged to achieve remo

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-10124

https://github.com/Nxploited/CVE-2024-10124-Poc

random_robbie@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-06T20:19:59.000Z ##

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-10124

##

CVE-2024-12172
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-12T06:31:02

1 posts

The WP Courses LMS – Online Courses Builder, eLearning Courses, Courses Solution, Education Courses plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the wpc_update_user_meta_option() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.21. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary user

##

CVE-2024-49113
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-12T02:04:37.610000

19 posts

Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/Sachinart/CVE-2024-49113-Checker

https://github.com/barcrange/CVE-2024-49113-Checker

https://github.com/SafeBreach-Labs/CVE-2024-49113

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.778Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit
There's a lot of interest in these two vulnerabilities (fixed by Microsoft in December 2024's Patch Tuesday) after SafeBreach published a proof of concept for both CVE-2024-49112 and 49113. A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer. Trend Micro provides a technical analysis of the infostealer and links to the indicators of compromise.

References:

  • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
decio at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.742Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113

#CyberVeille #LDAPNightmare #CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-03T13:45:52.490Z ##

LDAPNightmare: SafeBreach Labs Publishes First Proof-of-Concept Exploit for CVE-2024-49113
#CVE_2024_49113
https://www.safebreach.com/blog/ldapnightmare-safebreach-labs-publishes-first-proof-of-concept-exploit-for-cve-2024-49113/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit
There's a lot of interest in these two vulnerabilities (fixed by Microsoft in December 2024's Patch Tuesday) after SafeBreach published a proof of concept for both CVE-2024-49112 and 49113. A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer. Trend Micro provides a technical analysis of the infostealer and links to the indicators of compromise.

References:

  • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.000Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113
